availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Henry A. Borders (Lawrence County, Kentucky, farmer and 1st lieut)

body.p: Lawrence County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Joseph Borders and Julia A. Borders. Student in Lawrence County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farm hand in Lawrence County in 1860. Served in the 14th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as first sergeant, second lieutenant, and first lieutenant from December 10, 1861, to August 1, 1864. Died at the general field hospital in Marietta, Georgia, on August 1, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lawrence County, p. 83B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lawrence County, Louisa, p. 601
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0271.
Find A Grave, "Lieut Henry A. Borders (1840-1864)," Memorial #16874227, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/16874227 (accessed September 29, 2020).
